name: Mysteries of Eleusis
description:
In ancient Greece, great personalities and illustrious minds performed a series of rituals in veneration of Persephone called Mysteries of Eleusis, not because they could not be divulged but because they were impossible to explain.
They purified themselves and drank a spiritual drink called kykeon which contained a blend of intoxicating and psychoactive substances. In the token we can see a petroglyph where Demeter and Persephone exchange some mushrooms (300 B.C.)
